leitej.log

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • leitej.log.Logger

  • public final class Logger
extends java.lang.Object

    Logging messages for a specific system or application component.

    Logger object is obtained by calling static method getInstace(). For example 'private static final Logger LOG = Logger.getInstace();' in the class that uses the log. Each obtained instance is to be used inside the class that invoked it, for performance and output coherence.

    The log is configured based on the properties from the logging configuration file 'logger.prop.lt.xml' on the directory 'meta-inf'.

    Logger is multi-thread safe.

    The Logger class will put a call to close it self in the ShutdownHookUtil.addToLast(InvokeItf).

    Author:
    Julio Leite

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void close()
      Closes the logger (appenders).
      Before close it sends to debug log information about the use of JVM at this point.
      void debug(java.lang.String msg, java.lang.Object... args)
      Adds log at debug level.
      void error(java.lang.String msg, java.lang.Object... args)
      Adds log at error level.
      If any object in args argument has an instance of exception this method will also send a stack trace of this.
      void fatal(int exitStatus, java.lang.Throwable cause, java.lang.String msg, java.lang.Object... args)
      Adds log at fatal level.
      If any object in args argument has an instance of exception this method will also send a stack trace of this.
      After add the log this method throws a SeppukuLtRtException with the same message to log.
      void fatal(java.lang.String msg, java.lang.Object... args)
      Adds log at fatal level.
      If any object in args argument has an instance of exception this method will also send a stack trace of this.
      After add the log this method throws a SeppukuLtRtException with exit code 707, null cause and the same message as to log.
      static Logger getInstance() 
      static Logger getInstance(java.lang.Class<?> signClass)

      Adds log at info level.

      void warn(java.lang.String msg, java.lang.Object... args)

      • fatal

        public void fatal(java.lang.String msg,
                  java.lang.Object... args)
           throws SeppukuLtRtException
        Adds log at fatal level.
        If any object in args argument has an instance of exception this method will also send a stack trace of this.
        After add the log this method throws a SeppukuLtRtException with exit code 707, null cause and the same message as to log.
        Parameters:
        msg - text of the message to log
        args - objects to compose the text message
        Throws:
        SeppukuLtRtException - always
        See Also:
        SeppukuLtRtException

           throws SeppukuLtRtException
        Adds log at fatal level.
        If any object in args argument has an instance of exception this method will also send a stack trace of this.
        After add the log this method throws a SeppukuLtRtException with the same message to log.
        Parameters:
        exitStatus - Exit status
        cause - The nested exception
        msg - text of the message to log
        args - objects to compose the text message
        Throws:
        SeppukuLtRtException - always
        See Also:
